content.title: Production Linked Incentive Scheme (pli) For Promoting Telecom & Networking Products Manufacturing In India
content.details: The Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme would promote Telecom and Networking Products manufacturing in India and accordingly, a financial incentive is proposed to boost domestic manufacturing and attract investments in the target segments of telecom and networking products in order to encourage 'Make in India'. The Scheme is also expected to boost export of telecom and networking products 'Made in India'.
benefits: Attracts investments in telecom and networking sectors
Boosts export of telecom and networking products
eligibility: Companies registered in India under the Companies Act 2013
Minimum Global Revenue defined as per the Scheme Guidelines
Achievement of minimum threshold of cumulative incremental investment over four years
Incremental sales of manufactured goods net of taxes
Minimum investment threshold of ₹ 10 Crores for MSME and ₹ 100 Crores for others
exclusions: Companies declared as Non-Performing Asset (NPA) as per RBI guidelines
Wilful defaulters or reported as fraud by any bank or financial institution
Companies with insolvency proceedings admitted against them
content.application_process: Online application process with a non-refundable application fee of INR 1,00,000.
documents_required: Certificate of compliance with Design-led Manufacturing criteria
Declaration for specific products satisfying Design-led criteria
Financial statements for the base year

faqs.question: Can an existing PLI beneficiary company claim additional incentives?
faqs.answer: Yes, existing PLI beneficiaries can claim additional incentives of 1% for products qualified under Design-led Manufacturing.

faqs.question: What is the scheme outlay and tenure?
faqs.answer: The scheme will be implemented within the overall financial limits of Rs 12,195 Crores over a period of 5 years.

faqs.question: What are the eligible categories of investment?
faqs.answer: Investment can be made in Plant, Machinery, Equipment, Research and Development, and Transfer of Technology Agreements.
